history.content: Have you looked at the description in the COE guide for how to choose between 16A and 47D if you've taken Linear Algebra? They offer some good advice from Professor Ranade.

Just a word of warning, I took EECS47D the same semester as I took Math 110, and if you happen to lack discipline like I did...I'd recommend against it. It was a tough transition going from having nothing to do to having a problem set and discussions each week in the middle of the semester, and I ended up not doing the labs because it was hard to find one I could get into & I wouldn't have a partner. Because I knew linear algebra really well, I was able to do reasonably well on the homeworks / final, but I left without learning very much at all about circuits.

Given that I have taken Linear Algebra at a community college and am taking Math 110 this semester, would it be a good idea to take the EECS47D bridge course rather than EE16A? What would I miss out on if I choose to do this?
history.subject: EECS47D instead of EE16A?
